title: Heulahee
author: Heulahee
created_time: December 01, 2022, 04:21:50 PMLast edit: December 02, 2022, 07:41:15 AM by Heulahee
content: Hello, all the respected members of Bitcointalk!I have a youtube Channel Named Heulahee: Here is my channel Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNUfb-bM76VS2KVNZ1kykRAMost people stole my YouTube channel link and video Link, and they gave their Wallet Addresses to get the payment. These are all scammers.Like In Tdox Bounty (Video Campaign) Managed By @TheCrypto360, This person gives my youtube Channel Name And My YouTube Channel Linkhttps://imgur.com/a/h42zA1RSame in the Digicom Bounty (Video Campaign) run by the same Bounty Manager @TheCrypto360, Two persons give my channel Link in the spreadsheet and many of them update their values, due to these scammers, the bounty Manager banned me in the video campaign.https://imgur.com/a/NO3jsuchttps://imgur.com/a/5C1rZypMy Heart is completely broken today, And I send this message to the bounty Manager.https://imgur.com/a/mdjGZAmI request All the worthy Members of BitcoinTalk, Please help me out, I have a great struggle for making bounty videos, and the scammers do this at last, and my all struggle got in vain. Please help me @all

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.created_time: December 01, 2022, 04:53:38 PMLast edit: December 01, 2022, 05:04:39 PM by YOSHIE
comments.body: Hey, the bug is your internal problem with the named Bounty manager @TheCrypto360, only you two can solve the problem.I see what you're saying, deep Topic: ðŸ”¥âœ…ðŸ”¥ [BOUNTY] DIGICOM FINANCEðŸ”¥âœ…ðŸ”¥ A DIGITAL COMMERCE ðŸ”¥âœ…ðŸ”¥From data: spreadsheets, i also saw one user named @Miaallen, use your youtube/video channel named @Heulahee, both are Banned, without Stakes count.If you are the original youtube owner @Heulahee, of course you can contact the Bounty manager in this case, say to your manager 'a user stole my youtube channel, please block that user, have you said that to the Bounty manager.For sure the Bounty manager has full judgment and responsibility for the Bounty participants, or point the bounty manager to this thread, tell the truth someone stole the youtube channel, bottom line: the manager can make decisions in your case.Quote from: Heulahee on December 01, 2022, 04:59:42 PMI talked to the manager many times,Point that manager to this thread, PM/Telegram or similar, tell the manager the truth.Hope can help you.

comments.author: Heulahee
comments.created_time: December 01, 2022, 04:59:42 PMLast edit: December 02, 2022, 04:43:19 PM by mprep
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on December 01, 2022, 04:53:38 PMHey, the bug is your internal problem with the named Bounty manager @TheCrypto360, only you two can solve the problem.I see what you're saying, deep Topic: âœ… [BOUNTY] DIGICOM FINANCEâœ… A DIGITAL COMMERCE âœ…From data: spreadsheets, i also saw one user named @Miaallen, use your youtube/video channel named @Heulahee, both are Banned, without Stakes count.If you are the original youtube owner @Heulahee, of course you can contact the Bounty manager in this case, say to your manager 'a user stole my youtube channel, please block that user, have you said that to the Bounty manager.For sure the Bounty manager has full judgment and responsibility for the Bounty participants, or point the bounty manager to this thread, tell the truth someone stole the youtube channel, bottom line: the manager can make decisions in your case.I talked to the manager many times, but he didn't listen to me, because the scammer come from other ids of telegram and tell the manager in this tone "ban him, ban him". And manager ban me Along with these scammers.ok, I'm doing the same if it helps.[moderator's note: consecutive posts merged]

comments.author: Miaallen
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on December 01, 2022, 04:53:38 PMHey, the bug is your internal problem with the named Bounty manager @TheCrypto360, only you two can solve the problem.I see what you're saying, deep Topic: ðŸ”¥âœ…ðŸ”¥ [BOUNTY] DIGICOM FINANCEðŸ”¥âœ…ðŸ”¥ A DIGITAL COMMERCE ðŸ”¥âœ…ðŸ”¥From data: spreadsheets, i also saw one user named @Miaallen, use your youtube/video channel named @Heulahee, both are Banned, without Stakes count.If you are the original youtube owner @Heulahee, of course you can contact the Bounty manager in this case, say to your manager 'a user stole my youtube channel, please block that user, have you said that to the Bounty manager.For sure the Bounty manager has full judgment and responsibility for the Bounty participants, or point the bounty manager to this thread, tell the truth someone stole the youtube channel, bottom line: the manager can make decisions in your case.Quote from: Heulahee on December 01, 2022, 04:59:42 PMI talked to the manager many times,Point that manager to this thread, PM/Telegram or similar, tell the manager the truth.Hope can help you.I am the MIAALLEN and I'm not using anybody's details on that campaign. If you truly study the spreadsheet, you will see that I'm genuinely on Signature, Facebook and Telegram campaigns with same wallet. The scammer stole my forum details and stole heulahee's YouTube videos to register and put his own address which is different from the one I used for the 3 campaigns I'm genuinely working on

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: Miaallen on December 01, 2022, 06:33:31 PMI am the MIAALLEN and I'm not using anybody's details on that campaign. If you truly study the spreadsheet, you will see that I'm genuinely on Signature, Facebook and Telegram campaigns with same wallet. The scammer stole my forum details and stole heulahee's YouTube videos to register and put his own address which is different from the one I used for the 3 campaigns I'm genuinely working on Are you trying to claim that you're the owner of the heulahee YouTube channel.If yes, prove to us. Both of you post a simple video through the channel and share the link here. If you fail to prove, you will get tagged for being a cheat.

comments.author: Miaallen
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on December 01, 2022, 08:50:22 PMQuote from: Miaallen on December 01, 2022, 06:33:31 PMI am the MIAALLEN and I'm not using anybody's details on that campaign. If you truly study the spreadsheet, you will see that I'm genuinely on Signature, Facebook and Telegram campaigns with same wallet. The scammer stole my forum details and stole heulahee's YouTube videos to register and put his own address which is different from the one I used for the 3 campaigns I'm genuinely working on Are you trying to claim that you're the owner of the heulahee YouTube channel.If yes, prove to us. Both of you post a simple video through the channel and share the link here. If you fail to prove, you will get tagged for being a cheat.Maybe you need to read what I said again to understand the point I'm making. I am not participating in YouTube campaign. Someone registered using my forum details and Heulahee's YouTube challnnel to register and used his wallet address.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Miaallen on December 01, 2022, 09:10:10 PMMaybe you need to read what I said again to understand the point I'm making. I am not participating in YouTube campaign. Someone registered using my forum details and Heulahee's YouTube challnnel to register and used his wallet address. We need details. Who is that "someone"? If someone else is using your name to cheat, you should investigate and post the evidence so DT members can tag them. Do not expect someone else to do your work for you if you want to clear your name.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Quote from: Heulahee on December 01, 2022, 04:59:42 PMI talked to the manager many times, but he didn't listen to me, because the scammer come from other ids of telegram and tell the manager in this tone "ban him, ban him". And manager ban me Along with these scammers.These methods of deception are known, and I thought that competent campaign managers could deal with them without injustice to anyone.I do not know the manager of the bounty and how honest he is in performing his work, but I think the problem is easy and you can easily prove your ownership of the YouTube channel that publishes the videos participating in the campaign.Can you add your Bitcointalk nickname to the description of the video you are participating in or even your address with which you registered in the campaign? I think this is very easy, and if the campaign manager does not respond to you, he can be accused at that time .

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: Heulahee on December 01, 2022, 04:59:42 PMI talked to the manager many times, but he didn't listen to me, because the scammer come from other ids of telegram and tell the manager in this tone "ban him, ban him". And manager ban me Along with these scammers.I checked your YouTube channel and one of your entries is Digicom video you have your profile attached to it and authentication too,Â  the manager if he is a veteran a good manager can take note of this and he can easily verify your entry you should PM the manager here in Bitcointalk there are a lot of impostors on telegram when I was active in the bounty campaign and back then there was no authentication post many of my articles entries are submitted by impostors, you can file a scam accusation on the manager if he deprives you of your stakes that you deserve.

comments.author: Miaallen
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on December 01, 2022, 10:10:35 PMQuote from: Miaallen on December 01, 2022, 09:10:10 PMMaybe you need to read what I said again to understand the point I'm making. I am not participating in YouTube campaign. Someone registered using my forum details and Heulahee's YouTube challnnel to register and used his wallet address. We need details. Who is that "someone"? If someone else is using your name to cheat, you should investigate and post the evidence so DT members can tag them. Do not expect someone else to do your work for you if you want to clear your name.How else do I have to investigate and know who the person really is when I don't have access to the details submitted when registering for the campaign. I'm sure the bounty manager should have the Google email address that the person used in registering and see other registration that came from it and catch the cheater easily with the information I have already supplied to him.And also, since you're so interested in this, you also have access to the information we have on the spreadsheet and also a high rank forum member with much of experience beyond ours, you can help us out as the only information we have about the cheater is his or her wallet address which he used our names to register.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: OP, I'm going to give you my take on your situation, which might be much different than the opinions you've gotten so far.Your channel basically consists of videos in which you shill various crypto projects, and it's the same thing innumerable Youtubers are doing since they're paid to.Â  Just watching the first 30 seconds of your second video, you can tell you're reading off a script.Â  I've got no sympathy for you whatsoever, as much as I detest scammers.Â  All of these bounties for shit projects attract people willing to sell their integrity for some crappy token that's likely to be worthless--and that's if they have any integrity to begin with.Too bad, so sad, stop clogging up Youtube's search function with these asinine videos.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: OP, actually if you look up the address that copied your youtube videos you can see who did it.for example address 0x2C8696630f0968ad492793cf3cfB20DA934AA4Aa. registered in the Digicom Finance spreadsheet. you can see old account names that have been negatively tagged. If you want to see more, you can browse the transactions made.I will not publish, those rotten accounts have been doing this rotten work for a long time.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: Heulahee on December 01, 2022, 04:21:50 PMHello, all the respected members of Bitcointalk!I have a youtube Channel Named Heulahee: Here is my channel Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNUfb-bM76VS2KVNZ1kykRAMost people stole my YouTube channel link and video Link, and they gave their Wallet Addresses to get the payment. These are all scammers.Like In Tdox Bounty (Video Campaign) Managed By @TheCrypto360, This person gives my youtube Channel Name And My YouTube Channel Linkhttps://imgur.com/a/h42zA1RSame in the Digicom Bounty (Video Campaign) run by the same Bounty Manager @TheCrypto360, Two persons give my channel Link in the spreadsheet and many of them update their values, due to these scammers, the bounty Manager banned me in the video campaign.https://imgur.com/a/NO3jsuchttps://imgur.com/a/5C1rZypMy Heart is completely broken today, And I send this message to the bounty Manager.https://imgur.com/a/mdjGZAmI request All the worthy Members of BitcoinTalk, Please help me out, I have a great struggle for making bounty videos, and the scammers do this at last, and my all struggle got in vain. Please help me @allI lost my faith in Bounties back in 2017. Every single bounty I have managed has a minimum of 200 cheaters it seems. Messages daily about this guy stole this, this guy copied that, blah blah blah. It's probably the saddest thing in the world when dealing with videos and blogs in a bounty. The way to prove you own an account IMO is talk to the manager, tell him to give you a word to write and write it on your video in the description section. Don't discuss it openly, just talk privately. Same thing for an article or blog. When the manager sees the keyword, he will know you control the account and can mark anyone else using your link as cheaters. Best thing is stop doing bounties honestly. You're gonna be disappointed more often than happy.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: This is why you should never join bounties in the first place because it's hard to recognize which is one is the copy paste and which is one is the legit because anyone can just create new accounts to troll the bounty participants. Keep in mind those users wouldn't get banned since the forum didn't moderate such kind activity, if you're join signature campaign, there's will be no user will do this since it just ruining their own accounts.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on December 02, 2022, 12:33:40 AMYour channel basically consists of videos in which you shill various crypto projects, and it's the same thing innumerable Youtubers are doing since they're paid to.Â  Just watching the first 30 seconds of your second video, you can tell you're reading off a script.Â In one of my recent bounty, I found at least 60-70 video submission if I can remember correctly. Guess what happened, none of them qualified for video reward. I had to remove the video bounty from the campaign and had reallocated the fund for social media bounty.Quote from: Solosanz on December 02, 2022, 05:16:08 AMThis is why you should never join bounties in the first place because it's hard to recognize which is one is the copy paste and which is one is the legit because anyone can just create new accounts to troll the bounty participants.It's hard but not impossible. I'm not sure if every article I have checked was original or not but spending few hours would get the most common copy/paste author out of the pool. The problem is project owner hire campaign manager with small weekly/monthly payment which bring the worst quality in the campaign. Such campaign manager barely check the copy paste article. They simply give stake to them without checking the article throughly.

comments.author: Heulahee
comments.body: My Every information is mentioned at the video discription, Â my btt id, Â my POA, Â my polygon address, Â which I put in my Poa Link as well, Â not in a single video but in every video.So, thanks all of you for giving me some better choices, Â I'm now solving the issue with the bounty Manager directly, Â I'm closing this topic now. Thanks again.
